comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: What a fine ship. Amazing that she is still going strong as the 'Sedov' - en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sedov . She arrived in Sydney on Monday, 27/02/1933 and would not fit under the newly-completed Harbour Bridge - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16955953 . Docked at No.2 wharf Woolloomooloo 01/03/1933 for loading - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16981700 She left Sydney on Wednesday, 29/03/1933 loaded with 16,000 bales of wool for Falmouth - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16964569 . She set a record of 82 days on the trip - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16988268 .

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: Thank you for your contribution to our research efforts beachcomberaustralia, our records have been updated accordingly.
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] This is an excellent series of photos, and the blurb now much more interesting. A couple of other things happened while the ship was in Sydney in 1933 - - One of the trainee sailors, Walter Setzen, 16, broke his leg climbing the rocks at Coogee - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16973134 - Under instructions from the new Nazi government they changed the flag back to the German Imperial flag (horizontal bands of black white red) and a swastika flag (not spotted yet on these photos) - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16959672

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: Thank you again for your research efforts beachcomberaustralia, fascinating information!
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
